entry.title: death to the mempool, long live the mempool
entry.summary: The conversation between e, Lisa and ZmnSCPxj is about the current design of Bitcoin's transaction pool and how it can be improved. ZmnSCPxj suggests gossiping mining endpoints instead of transactions to increase anonymity and reduce global bandwidth usage, although this method may be more expensive than having a persistent identity. They also discuss the importance of anonymity in transactions, as well as the potential limitations of contacting all miners globally to confirm transactions. In addition, ZmnSCPxj emphasizes the need for everyone to look like a potential miner on the network to improve security, rather than treating miners as someone else.
